Class DefaultNeuralNetwork

java.lang.Object
net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.DefaultNeuralNetwork
All Implemented Interfaces:
EstimationFunction, NeuralNetwork, TrainableFunction
Direct Known Subclasses:
Adaline, MultiLayerPerceptron, Perceptron
@Mediator public class DefaultNeuralNetwork extends Object implements NeuralNetwork
Provides a standard implementation for a neural network.

A neural network is modeled here as an extensible estimation strategy: it accepts inputs (features), transforms them through a series of layers composed of Neurons and weighted connections, and produces outputs (predictions).

    • getOutputConnections

      public Map<Neuron,Float> getOutputConnections(int l, int j)
      Returns the outgoing connections of a given neuron in the network.

      Each connection is represented as a mapping from a target neuron to the weight of the connection.

      Specified by:
      getOutputConnections in interface NeuralNetwork
      Parameters:
      l - the layer index of the source neuron
      j - the index of the source neuron within the layer
      Returns:
      a map of target neurons to their associated connection weights

    • getParameters

      public float[] getParameters()
      Returns all parameters (weights, biases) of the network as a flat array.

      The order of parameters is implementation-defined but must be consistent across calls to enable saving and restoring network state.

      Specified by:
      getParameters in interface NeuralNetwork
      Specified by:
      getParameters in interface TrainableFunction
      Returns:
      a flat array of parameters

      Returns:

    • arity

      public int arity()
      Returns the arity of this function, i.e. the number of inputs (independent variables or features) it expects.

      For example:

      • A univariate function f(x) has arity 1.
      • A multivariate function f(x, y, z) has arity 3.
      • In machine learning, this corresponds to the input feature dimension.
      Specified by:
      arity in interface EstimationFunction
      Returns:
      the number of inputs (arity) this function accepts

    • coArity

      public int coArity()
      Returns the co-arity of this function, i.e. the number of outputs (dependent variables or results) it produces.

      For example:

      • A scalar-valued function f(x, y) → ℝ has co-arity 1.
      • A vector-valued function f(x, y) → ℝ² has co-arity 2.
      • In machine learning, this corresponds to the output dimension (e.g., number of labels or regression targets).
      Specified by:
      coArity in interface EstimationFunction
      Returns:
      the number of outputs (co-arity) this function produces

    • accept

      public void accept(NeuronVisitor visitor)
      Accepts a visitor to inspect the complete neural network
      Specified by:
      accept in interface NeuralNetwork
      Parameters:
      visitor - the visitor to apply to this network
